verses.verse: Then went <WH3212> Samson <WH8123> to Gaza <WH5804>, and saw <WH7200> there an harlot <WH802> <WH2181>, and went in <WH935> unto her. harlot: Heb. a woman an harlot

And it was told the Gazites <WH5841>, saying <WH559>, Samson <WH8123> is come <WH935> hither. And they compassed him in <WH5437>, and laid wait <WH693> for him all night <WH3915> in the gate <WH8179> of the city <WH5892>, and were quiet <WH2790> all the night <WH3915>, saying <WH559>, In the morning <WH1242>, when it is day <WH216>, we shall kill <WH2026> him. quiet: Heb. silent

And Samson <WH8123> lay <WH7901> till midnight <WH2677> <WH3915>, and arose <WH6965> at midnight <WH2677> <WH3915>, and took <WH270> the doors <WH1817> of the gate <WH8179> of the city <WH5892>, and the two <WH8147> posts <WH4201>, and went away <WH5265> with them, bar <WH1280> and all, and put <WH7760> them upon his shoulders <WH3802>, and carried them up <WH5927> to the top <WH7218> of an hill <WH2022> that is before <WH6440> Hebron <WH2275>. bar: Heb. with the bar
And it came to pass afterward <WH310>, that he loved <WH157> a woman <WH802> in the valley <WH5158> of Sorek <WH7796>, whose name <WH8034> was Delilah <WH1807>. in: or, by the brook

And the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> came up <WH5927> unto her, and said <WH559> unto her, Entice <WH6601> him, and see <WH7200> wherein his great <WH1419> strength <WH3581> lieth, and by what means we may prevail <WH3201> against him, that we may bind <WH631> him to afflict <WH6031> him: and we will give <WH5414> thee every one <WH376> of us eleven hundred <WH505> <WH3967> pieces of silver <WH3701>. afflict: or, humble

And Delilah <WH1807> said <WH559> to Samson <WH8123>, Tell <WH5046> me, I pray thee, wherein thy great <WH1419> strength <WH3581> lieth, and wherewith thou mightest be bound <WH631> to afflict <WH6031> thee.

And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559> unto her, If they bind <WH631> me with seven <WH7651> green <WH3892> withs <WH3499> that were never dried <WH2717>, then shall I be weak <WH2470>, and be as another <WH259> man <WH120>. green: or, new cords: Heb. moist another: Heb. one

Then the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> brought up <WH5927> to her seven <WH7651> green <WH3892> withs <WH3499> which had not been dried <WH2717>, and she bound <WH631> him with them. green: or, new cords: Heb. moist

Now there were men lying in wait <WH693>, abiding <WH3427> with her in the chamber <WH2315>. And she said <WH559> unto him, The Philistines <WH6430> be upon thee, Samson <WH8123>. And he brake <WH5423> the withs <WH3499>, as a thread <WH6616> of tow <WH5296> is broken <WH5423> when it toucheth <WH7306> the fire <WH784>. So his strength <WH3581> was not known <WH3045>. toucheth: Heb. smelleth

And Delilah <WH1807> said <WH559> unto Samson <WH8123>, Behold, thou hast mocked <WH2048> me, and told <WH1696> me lies <WH3577>: now tell <WH5046> me, I pray thee, wherewith thou mightest be bound <WH631>.

And he said <WH559> unto her, If they bind <WH631> me fast <WH631> with new <WH2319> ropes <WH5688> that never were occupied <WH4399> <WH6213>, then shall I be weak <WH2470>, and be as another <WH259> man <WH120>. that never: Heb. wherewith work hath not been done

Delilah <WH1807> therefore took <WH3947> new <WH2319> ropes <WH5688>, and bound <WH631> him therewith, and said <WH559> unto him, The Philistines <WH6430> be upon thee, Samson <WH8123>. And there were liers in wait <WH693> abiding <WH3427> in the chamber <WH2315>. And he brake <WH5423> them from off his arms <WH2220> like a thread <WH2339>.

And Delilah <WH1807> said <WH559> unto Samson <WH8123>, Hitherto <WH2008> thou hast mocked <WH2048> me, and told <WH1696> me lies <WH3577>: tell <WH5046> me wherewith thou mightest be bound <WH631>. And he said <WH559> unto her, If thou weavest <WH707> the seven <WH7651> locks <WH4253> of my head <WH7218> with the web <WH4545>.

And she fastened <WH8628> it with the pin <WH3489>, and said <WH559> unto him, The Philistines <WH6430> be upon thee, Samson <WH8123>. And he awaked <WH3364> out of his sleep <WH8142>, and went away <WH5265> with the pin <WH3489> of the beam <WH708>, and with the web <WH4545>.

And she said <WH559> unto him, How <WH349> canst thou say <WH559>, I love <WH157> thee, when thine heart <WH3820> is not with me? thou hast mocked <WH2048> me these three <WH7969> times <WH6471>, and hast not told <WH5046> me wherein thy great <WH1419> strength <WH3581> lieth.

And it came to pass, when she pressed <WH6693> him daily <WH3117> with her words <WH1697>, and urged <WH509> him, so that his soul <WH5315> was vexed <WH7114> unto death <WH4191>; vexed: Heb. shortened

That he told <WH5046> her all his heart <WH3820>, and said <WH559> unto her, There hath not come <WH5927> a razor <WH4177> upon mine head <WH7218>; for I have been a Nazarite <WH5139> unto God <WH430> from my mother's <WH517> womb <WH990>: if I be shaven <WH1548>, then my strength <WH3581> will go <WH5493> from me, and I shall become weak <WH2470>, and be like any other man <WH120>.

And when Delilah <WH1807> saw <WH7200> that he had told <WH5046> her all his heart <WH3820>, she sent <WH7971> and called <WH7121> for the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430>, saying <WH559>, Come up <WH5927> this once <WH6471>, for he hath shewed <WH5046> me all his heart <WH3820>. Then the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> came up <WH5927> unto her, and brought <WH5927> money <WH3701> in their hand <WH3027>.

And she made him sleep <WH3462> upon her knees <WH1290>; and she called <WH7121> for a man <WH376>, and she caused him to shave off <WH1548> the seven <WH7651> locks <WH4253> of his head <WH7218>; and she began <WH2490> to afflict <WH6031> him, and his strength <WH3581> went <WH5493> from him.

And she said <WH559>, The Philistines <WH6430> be upon thee, Samson <WH8123>. And he awoke <WH3364> out of his sleep <WH8142>, and said <WH559>, I will go out <WH3318> as at other times before <WH6471>, and shake <WH5287> myself. And he wist <WH3045> not that the LORD <WH3068> was departed <WH5493> from him.

But the Philistines <WH6430> took <WH270> him, and put out <WH5365> his eyes <WH5869>, and brought him down <WH3381> to Gaza <WH5804>, and bound <WH631> him with fetters of brass <WH5178>; and he did grind <WH2912> in the prison <WH631> house <WH1004>. put out: Heb. bored out
Howbeit the hair <WH8181> of his head <WH7218> began <WH2490> to grow again <WH6779> after <WH834> he was shaven <WH1548>. after: or, as when he was shaven

Then the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> gathered them together <WH622> for to offer <WH2076> a great <WH1419> sacrifice <WH2077> unto Dagon <WH1712> their god <WH430>, and to rejoice <WH8057>: for they said <WH559>, Our god <WH430> hath delivered <WH5414> Samson <WH8123> our enemy <WH341> into our hand <WH3027>.

And when the people <WH5971> saw <WH7200> him, they praised <WH1984> their god <WH430>: for they said <WH559>, Our god <WH430> hath delivered <WH5414> into our hands <WH3027> our enemy <WH341>, and the destroyer <WH2717> of our country <WH776>, which slew <WH2491> many <WH7235> of us. which: Heb. and who multiplied our slain

And it came to pass, when their hearts <WH3820> were merry <WH2896>, that they said <WH559>, Call <WH7121> for Samson <WH8123>, that he may make us sport <WH7832>. And they called <WH7121> for Samson <WH8123> out of the prison <WH631> house <WH1004>; and he made them <WH6440> sport <WH6711>: and they set <WH5975> him between the pillars <WH5982>. them: Heb. before them

And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559> unto the lad <WH5288> that held <WH2388> him by the hand <WH3027>, Suffer <WH3240> me that I may feel <WH4184> <WH3237> the pillars <WH5982> whereupon the house <WH1004> standeth <WH3559>, that I may lean <WH8172> upon them.

Now the house <WH1004> was full <WH4390> of men <WH582> and women <WH802>; and all the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> were there; and there were upon the roof <WH1406> about three <WH7969> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> and women <WH802>, that beheld <WH7200> while Samson <WH8123> made sport <WH7832>.

And Samson <WH8123> called <WH7121> unto the LORD <WH3068>, and said <WH559>, O Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069>, remember <WH2142> me, I pray thee, and strengthen <WH2388> me, I pray thee, only this once <WH6471>, O God <WH430>, that I may be at once <WH259> avenged <WH5358> <WH5359> of the Philistines <WH6430> for my two <WH8147> eyes <WH5869>.

And Samson <WH8123> took hold <WH3943> of the two <WH8147> middle <WH8432> pillars <WH5982> upon which the house <WH1004> stood <WH3559>, and on which it was borne up <WH5564>, of the one <WH259> with his right hand <WH3225>, and of the other <WH259> with his left <WH8040>. on which: or, he leaned on them

And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559>, Let me die <WH4191> <WH5315> with the Philistines <WH6430>. And he bowed <WH5186> himself with all his might <WH3581>; and the house <WH1004> fell <WH5307> upon the lords <WH5633>, and upon all the people <WH5971> that were therein. So the dead <WH4191> which he slew <WH4191> at his death <WH4194> were more <WH7227> than they which he slew <WH4191> in his life <WH2416>. me: Heb. my soul

Then his brethren <WH251> and all the house <WH1004> of his father <WH1> came down <WH3381>, and took <WH5375> him, and brought him up <WH5927>, and buried <WH6912> him between Zorah <WH6881> and Eshtaol <WH847> in the buryingplace <WH6913> of Manoah <WH4495> his father <WH1>. And he judged <WH8199> Israel <WH3478> twenty <WH6242> years <WH8141>.
